title: I feel bad for all of you that still believe Riot can unfuck their game at this point
body:
Because when every moment spent in game is just a complete frustrating mess for half the people playing in it you dont have a good game.

When you dread every patch note, waiting to see which of Riot's top 30, out of the entire 150 champ roster, get changed to be even more unbearable to compete with each other you dont have a good game.

When you have to make an in-game mission to support your "ESPORT" views but your client is too buggy to even register it being done you dont have a good game.

When the developers of the game put more effort into adding an unending slew of increasingly terrible ideas to the "balance" mix instead of focusing on fixing painfully apparent issues that already exist you dont have a good game.

League of Legends is not a good game, and it's sad to see so many forcing themselves to go through this infuriating frustration daily just to do... what exactly? Have fun? I dont think anyone even knows what fun feels like in this game anymore with how much of a thoughtless call of duty click and kill its become...

replies.body:
I just took a statistic view of my current seasons performance. And I found out my deathrate has become 0.5 higher on all champions compared to past seasons. I use control mages. One of the champion classes that do not go in the front or get killed often and I'm a extremely cautious player who nearly wards the same amount as my support as midlaner.

...This game has changed.
The game has changed, son of Flynn.
How is this not upvoted more? Honestly, its heart wrenching :'(
I see you are a man of culture

The overpowered champions are so blatantly obvious, but the excuse for not balancing them is always "you're just bad, the champion is fine" or "it's balanced in pro play". I'm getting tired of it to be honest.

That's like copy-paste argument for almost every HOTS related topics. With a bucket of downvotes cause how dare I say something different than holy circle of blizzard fans.

Yea, I know it's LOL forum, not HOTS.. Sorry, just can't use their own forum because of mod-enforced bashing against anyone with different opinion (my ass is sore cause of that bullshit) :|

Anyways, carry on ;P
Right? In B4 all the guys with "fox" in their name come to say, "Game is fine, nothing to see here, move along"

The non-vocal people who enjoy this game but dont speak out about it due to the echo chamber the boards is for hating riot enjoy this game. I personally enjoy it because it always changes. People complain that "X is broken fix it" but to me something will always be the best. There is no perfect balance and some people are always going to have an opinion on how to balance the game. But to me I look at each patch as a new challenge to learn something new. I'm an adc main and when marksmen went away I didn't complain. I loved learning the new bot laners and trying some fresh stuff out. I get it though. It can be frustrating to see Graves in all of your games. There will be some down parts every year for everyone but the fact of the matter is league is ever changing so it won't last and new challenges will pop up. I think this whole balance team sucks is just a mentality. People just want an excuse because they can't cope with what's strong and learn new things. Just my opinion however. Hope everyone has a great day!
Yeah the millions of people who already left the game and don't follow it anymore are silent too.

Because games can only grow up, right? Things like boredom or burnout doesn't exist? I guess when you start playing a game you never stop, no matter if you still enjoy it or no? 

Sparky is right here.
It's alot easier to burn out when game's shit, rather than fun to play, you know...

I still can't see how game is shit, since people are complaining mostly about oneshots which are with us since s1.

Seriously, what is so bad in your eyes geez

> which are with us since s1.

Cause in S1 you had only few of them. Now pretty much everything can oneshot you. There's hardly class distinction when everyone does everything

In s1 any AP champion could oneshot after buying DFG, crit carries like Yi/Trynd/ADCs were two-three shotting too (im pretty sure in s2 i was oneshotting people with Gankplank crit Q) and bruisers like Jax were building much more offence. The Titanic AA resets kind of breaks him, but overall, damage in s1-s2 was on similar levels. 

Actually im glad not only mages and crit carries can deal burst damage now. Champions like Camille were really needed in the game.
This game is fun AF.  If you disagree, then don't play it.  It's not like you paid for the game.  Go play WoW or Dota 2 or CoD or something.  People love crying about everything in this board :D

> [{quoted}](name=Madisonivy6969,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=KWZTWzUL,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2018-10-09T10:59:29.657+0000)
>
> This game is fun AF.  If you disagree, then don't play it.  It's not like you paid for the game.  Go play WoW or Dota 2 or CoD or something.  People love crying about everything in this board :D

If you connected to this game on an emotional level, ofc people you would be angry if devs turned the game into something you 'didnt fall in love with'.
To clarify, I'm sure many people made great memories in League, and the game turend into something that's not enjoyable to them. But they keep playing because of that connection.

Actually, while League does not have an initial price, I'm willing to bet at 
least 90% of the people above level 30 have spent 20 or more bucks on this game. And even if they haven't they've still probably put in tens to hundreds of hours.

Due to this you can't simply say "just go to a different game".  Most of us are too invested to turn our back on League even if the current state isn't too great.
What does Donald Trump have to do with anything?????

tbh the game is even a pain when winning.

Either you have no impact at all or have to play so carefully because 0/9 "*insert any assassin/bruiser/whatever*" still oneshots you.
Even if you get fed your skill expression is literally zero because the enemy blows up just as fast as yourself.

And to get to your point: I don't think either that the game will ever be stable because Riot destroyed the fundament of the game (balanced runes/masterys and base stats of champions)

Heh, having no impact, you don't even know the old days of feast and famine.
In the old days if you played a feast and famine champion, you literally make the game a 4 v 5 for your team, you were useless, you dealt 0 damage, and you died instantly, you had no pressure at all so you can't even farm, so you couldn't get back in the game with farm.

On the enemy side, an 0/9 "insert whatever" could not one shot you at all back then, and would never have the chance, to get back in, and today's 0/9 insert whatever still can't one shot you, unless they have farm backing them up.

If the feast and famine champion was fed, god help trying to shut them down.

People should be happy that feast and famine champions hardly exists anymore, any playstyles that do, they aren't anywhere as close as to usless when they're behind, and they're nowhere near as obnoxious when they're ahead.

"old days?" - When was that, season 1?

I play since season 3 and I can tell you from experience, that it was better. 

And "feast and famine" champions are totally fine. It felt rewarding when you won, and it felt shitty if you fed and it was deserved, that's my whole point.
0/9 was me exaggerating but my point stands. 
How many games did I play where my enemy laner with 0/4/1 one shots my other team mates and gets fed for no reason. Just because damage is too high.

> In the old days if you played a feast and famine champion, you literally make the game a 4 v 5 for your team 

How is that any different now?
And now you make the game a 4v5 if you pick the wrong champion, because meta champs like Graves faceroll and win games easily.

Having 0 chance to get back into a game because you picked a feast and famine champ is shit, there should be risks in picking feast and famine like champions, but never being able to get a chance to catch up in gold/exp is the worst experience. 
I've played since mid way season 2, and it's taken them a long time 'till feast and famine wasn't as punishing and rewarding as it is today.

How is the game any different now? Old days, feast and famine champions when behind along with playing non S-Tier or A-Tier champs means you made the game 4v5.

Today, you can play even some of the lower tiered champions and still do well. How do you win when you aren't picking top tier champs? Know your match up, and know your champ, legit 2 things that's all, and maybe know your team comp. Yes there are still blatantly OP meta champs, that's something that can't be avoided.

I swear, people who horde around and praise meta champs play non-meta champs for 1 game, get stomped and say, "This champ is useless! why play x, when I can play y and just win." It doesn't fucking work that way, there are so many variables that can make a champ strong and many weak, and it's not just numbers in their kit.
Match ups, team comps, map awareness, how you interact with your match up, the champion's kit, etc. just to name a few.
You don't pick 5 squishy meta champions into a 2 assassin 1 diver team comp and just scream out "they're op, getting deleted under 1 sec, no counter play," not at all. You guys just butchered a good portion of your chance to win in pick phase, but it doesn't mean it's impossible to win, and that's the best thing about modern league. Your mistakes, your teams's mistakes, they matter, you'll be put behind, your team will be put behind, but it's no longer the end of the world for the 1 single teammate that made all the mistakes, or the few mistakes your team makes, if you think otherwise, help out your team more, and it doesn't have to be being a guard dog of the champ that's behind, force the enemy team elsewhere, relieve pressure on the player that's behind, they can catch up, just do something, not just give up.

They can unfuck the game very easily by reverting rune changes and never bringing things like Arcane comet Conqueror Electrocute ect into the game and removing items like Stormrazor Duskblade ect.
Also firing CertainlyT and never hiring someone as braindead as him and allowing them to create literal problematic designed champions for multiple years.
Oh trust me it's very much possible but they just refuse to do so.
I like the new Runes but I agree with all the other points.  CT really needs to go.
CertainlyT should really be moved to a singleplayer project where his ideas would shine rather than be highly polarizing.
I don't believe it, haven't for along time actually. I'm only playing this game because I have no better alternatives.

Season 9 is going to decide whether i stay or not. Ill stay through Preseason to see if any problems are being addressed, otherwise if its the same RNG game where you stomp or be stomped then I will uninstall and probably not come back. Thats what happened with me and Call of Duty. Advanced Warfare sucked, I gave them one more chance, they bring exo suits back in the next cod, never played a CoD since, even tho I hear CoD stopped with the exo suits, its too late. Thats exactly whats going to happen to League too, once they start dying, they will be forced to get a new balance team and listen to the community. But by the time that happens, they will already have lost over half their community, which theyll have to bring something big and exciting to the players to even make them think twice about coming back.
I enjoy the game thoroughly if your opinion is that the game sucks then please stay away and that includes discussion boards about the game.

more if you dont play it you cant talk about it and so many people on these boards come here to complain and at the same time will say they havent played in months.

> [{quoted}](name=KFCeytron,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=KWZTWzUL,comment-id=0013000000000000,timestamp=2018-10-09T18:12:19.299+0000)
>
> 

how is it fair to have any conversation about game balance when people have not played the game in months.
Simple, maybe they watched someone play in person or on stream.  Pretty easy to tell the state of the game by watching it honestly.

> [{quoted}](name=Anags,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=KWZTWzUL,comment-id=001300000000000000000001,timestamp=2018-10-10T16:17:21.253+0000)
>
> Simple, maybe they watched someone play in person or on stream.  Pretty easy to tell the state of the game by watching it honestly.

I really disagree but that is your opinion.

Sad truth. The game has indeed become a piece of shit.

Frankly i dont understand how it devolved into its current state but i doubt it could have done so without Riot actually wanting to take it in this direction. A portion of the community likes it too, mostly the kids who like to play brain dead assassins if id have to guess, they are no doubt having a great time.

And you're right i dont think they will fix it, they dont want to. They will change it just enough to stop a large amount of the complaints
Started in S5
The difference is, a game of Call of Duty can be fun... League... well I can't even say "Good try buddy" because its not.
i think the game is good and i'm having fun with it

Minority doesn't count as the majority.

The game is shit.

> [{quoted}](name=Flamingdusk,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=KWZTWzUL,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2018-10-09T10:07:36.427+0000)
>
> Minority doesn't count as the majority.
> 
> The game is shit.

Ironic that you lot don’t realize you’re the minority LUL

One problem with that argument: YOU HAVE NO PROOF.

Just because one side is vocal doesn’t mean they’re the majority; it just means that they’re the angriest demographic. The people who like the game don’t say anything because they don’t really have a reason to. Because of this, there is no factual way of determining who the majority is with the information currently available.

Season 8 is a lot better than season 6 and 7

Season 6 made jungling by far the best role and season 7 made supports by far the best role because of ardent cancer.

At least in season 8, there aren't any roles that are blatantly overpowered and the meta is decent.

Did I mention season 6 had dynamicQ?
Jungling is still by far the best role lmao.
It's the best role to have a impact early, good luck carrying in late if your name isn't Graves
Or Kindred, Kha'zix, Shaco, Evelynn, Gragas, Camille, Kai'sa, Skarner, Warwick or Udyr.

Yes, no, no, possibly, once in a blue moon, once in a blue moon, not a primary jungler, no, no, only against dumb enemies

I'd rather try to carry after 20 minutes as a 2 items Tristana than 3 items Shaco/Skarner/WW
At this point, I'm waiting to see what Season 9 does. If there's no fix, then I'm quitting for good. I barely play anyway, but I'm curious to see if they'll lower damage or not.
Well, it can. just very, VERY unlikely
